intro: Clidemia riedeliana, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats, often in forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. Clidemia riedeliana plays an important ecological role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining the biodiversity of Hawaiian ecosystems.
